title: Regenerative In Situ Formed Bi Nanoparticles on Bi2O2CO3 Nanosheets with Bi-Vacancies for Efficient and Stable Photocatalytic CO2 Reduction to Formate
content:
Energy Environ. Sci., 2024, Accepted Manuscript
DOI: 10.1039/D4EE02356K, Paper
Donglian Wen, Jie Zhao, Yang You, Liang Huang, Haoheng Zhu, Chuanghui Zhang, Donglei Bu, Shaoming Huang
Photocatalytic CO2 reduction to formate suffers from poor productivity, selectivity, stability and recyclability. To conquer these drawbacks, a new facile strategy has been utilized to create regenerative in situ formed...
